intro: Stenogyne semipilosa, commonly known as the hairy stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its botanical heritage.
